snippet: In the early days of "The Colbert Report," Colbert's persona was more rigid than it is now, and not everyone knew what to make of it-least of all Barney Frank, who may have been the show's most baffled and uncomfortable interviewee.
abstract: In the early days of "The Colbert Report," Colbert's persona was more rigid than it is now, and not everyone knew what to make of it-least of all Barney Frank, who may have been the show's most baffled and uncomfortable interviewee.
